level.text: The purpose of this chapter is to outline the policy for official publications.

The Administrative Procedure Act, Pub. L. No.90-614, (D.C. Code §§ 1-1501 et seq.) established the District of Columbia Register (referred to as the D.C. Register) as the official publication for giving notice to the public of rules and regulations as well as items of general interest.
In addition to rules and regulations, the following items are authorized to be published in accordance with D.C. Code § 1-1533:
Cumulative indexes to regulations which have been adopted, amended, or repealed;
Information on changes in the organization of the District government;
Codifications of rules and regulations; and
Such other matters as may from time to time be determined to be of general public interest.

Publication in the D.C. Register of rules adopted, amended, or repealed shall not be considered as a substitute for publication in one or more newspapers of general circulation when that publication is required.
All courts within the District shall take judicial notice of rules published or of which notice is given in the D.C. Register pursuant to D.C. Code § 1-1505(b).
Pursuant to the requirements of D.C. Law 2-153, the D.C. Register shall be published by the District of Columbia Office of Documents and Administrative Issuances.

level.heading: AUTHORITY
level.text: Unless otherwise noted, the authority for this chapter is the District of Columbia Administrative Procedure Act, Pub. L. No. 90-614, 82 Stat. 1203 (codified at D.C. Code, §§ 1-1501 et seq.)
